revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-18 16:14:30.000000000', 'message': "Fix ovn-db-sync-util after removing l3 ovsdb connection

As a result of d92e71c2 the sync util can fail because it tries to
look up the ovsdb connection from the mechanism_manager under 'ovn'
but the sync util registers under 'ovn-sync'.

Change-Id: I6998b08672761a501e427aab5d581064d9425dde
Closes-Bug: #1876752
(cherry picked from Neutron commit 18dd0d4e)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix ovn-db-sync-util after removing l3 ovsdb connection

As a result of d92e71c2 the sync util can fail because it tries to
look up the ovsdb connection from the mechanism_manager under 'ovn'
but the sync util registers under 'ovn-sync'.

Change-Id: I6998b08672761a501e427aab5d581064d9425dde
Closes-Bug: #1876752
(cherry picked from Neutron commit 18dd0d4e)

commit_message:
Change Ganesha to HA deploy

This change also modifies the ganesha + manila-share
services to run via pacemaker to enable them to be
colocated with the VIP, a requirement to run manila
and ganesha in a highly available configuration

Change-Id: Idd0b594c24ef029f2415ee9ca13a8aca6d01d2a7
Closes-Bug: #1867358

commit_message:
Remove translation sections from setup.cfg

These translation sections are not needed anymore, Babel can
generate translation files without them.

Change-Id: I18696d80bad13d2f3e31ed1ad8f046fb9a202e16

subject: Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions
messages: [{'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-05-26 06:59:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2020-05-26 11:06:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-05-26 12:52:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-26 06:59:33.000000000', 'message': "Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

Remove docs requirements from lower-constraints, they are not needed
during install or test but only for docs building.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: Ife447363df7ed70ee9d813cc70c236efdbb916b6
"}]
commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

Remove docs requirements from lower-constraints, they are not needed
during install or test but only for docs building.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: Ife447363df7ed70ee9d813cc70c236efdbb916b6

Fix sphinx playbook: install-if-python was renamed

The new name is ensure-if-python, use it to unbreak the sphinx job.

Change-Id: If03c299eea48aa73e0ef320d0f4903b2effb3ba1

commit_message:
install-deps: use system pip and bindep for installing dependencies

Updating pip was required long ago to work around Ubuntu and CentOS 7
problems. Now even CentOS 8 has pip 9.0 which should be enough for us.

Also moving binary dependencies to bindep and install them before
we try to install Python dependencies (to be able to compile them).

Workarounds is needed for segfault on Ubuntu because of cryptography:
remove python3-cryptography package and avoid --ignore-installed.

This change makes install-deps work on openSUSE again.

Change-Id: Ib9b81075f35068c046880de46b20f98ef71a8d8e

commit_message:
Ensure that stale flows are cleaned from phys_bridges

In case when neutron-ovs-agent will notice that any of physical
bridges was "re-created", we should also ensure that stale Open
Flow rules (with old cookie id) are cleaned.
This patch is doing exactly that.

Change-Id: I7c7c8a4c371d6f4afdaab51ed50950e2b20db30f
Related-Bug: #1864822

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-21 14:30:34.000000000', 'message': "[devstack][ci] Modify firewall in ds-plugin

To set up some first party backends such as
ZFSOnLinux, CephFS via NFS gateway, Container
(where the NAS server is containerized) and LVM,
manila's devstack plugin creates a NAS server
on the devstack host.

On test machines, access to this NAS server is
firewalled from networks outside of the host's
internal network namespace (including from private
project networks that are in different network
namespaces, on the same devstack host).

We currently use a legacy devstack-gate script
to disable firewall on NFS ports; however,
anyone that installs devstack with LVM, Container,
ZFSOnLinux, CephFS-NFS drivers will need these
firewall ports to be opened to be able to mount
shares exported off their devstack host machines.

Move these firewall commands to the devstack plugin.
These commands can be invoked by setting the localrc
variable MANILA_ALLOW_NAS_SERVER_PORTS_ON_HOST to True.
The value of this variable is False by default,
to preserve existing behavior.

Change-Id: Ic9cad47662f1edf2e5c710dbe64d580bc5f01d44
(cherry picked from commit 36b1715e86919a739d3639f9c0d2c80e9f853e7a)
(cherry picked from commit 94486eb4c09ac64f0e7cdf34945a84b11c1b0ae0)
(cherry picked from commit e7b4507de4e8fbb8f2a1919519ddb22e545ac0c7)
(cherry picked from commit 3f2f7b66b112f34412da3e998486b239ff372905)
(cherry picked from commit 4008c86f4ef9fde44e83a7704265cab8b4e2d2aa)
"}]
commit_message:
[devstack][ci] Modify firewall in ds-plugin

To set up some first party backends such as
ZFSOnLinux, CephFS via NFS gateway, Container
(where the NAS server is containerized) and LVM,
manila's devstack plugin creates a NAS server
on the devstack host.

On test machines, access to this NAS server is
firewalled from networks outside of the host's
internal network namespace (including from private
project networks that are in different network
namespaces, on the same devstack host).

We currently use a legacy devstack-gate script
to disable firewall on NFS ports; however,
anyone that installs devstack with LVM, Container,
ZFSOnLinux, CephFS-NFS drivers will need these
firewall ports to be opened to be able to mount
shares exported off their devstack host machines.

Move these firewall commands to the devstack plugin.
These commands can be invoked by setting the localrc
variable MANILA_ALLOW_NAS_SERVER_PORTS_ON_HOST to True.
The value of this variable is False by default,
to preserve existing behavior.

Change-Id: Ic9cad47662f1edf2e5c710dbe64d580bc5f01d44
(cherry picked from commit 36b1715e86919a739d3639f9c0d2c80e9f853e7a)

commit_message:
Make manila-tempest-plugin installation optional

manila-tempest-plugin can be installed with its
devstack plugin; Installing it via manila's plugin
is unnecessary. So, deprecate its installation
in the DevStack plugin.

This change is being backported to the stable branches
to allow Zuulv3 style jobs to eventually be supported
on these branches. Without this change, installation
of manila will fail on Zuulv3 jobs with the error:

  'The /opt/stack/manila-tempest-plugin project was not found;
  if this is a gate job, add the project to the $PROJECTS variable
  in the job definition.'
   die 563 'Cloning not allowed in this configuration'

If manila-tempest-plugin is added to $PROJECTS as suggested,
we'll end up double cloning this project, once via its
devstack plugin and once in manila's own devstack plugin.

Change-Id: I21c08069ff82b3bfb52ef7ac960183ddc866c2ee
(cherry picked from commit 8d03a2a46e233b3628ffe59af67c1feb789e1669)
(cherry picked from commit d39d930274ee78ef55720a8719c91a8eb7303bc7)
(cherry picked from commit 195276bfaa28afd317619ca6612e89263c8dbf3e)
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>

commit_message:
[devstack][ci] Set public network ID in tempest.conf

When running IPv6 tests, we disable the creation of
the public network in devstack, and handle it in the
devstack plugin. So, we'll need to configure it
in tempest in the plugin.

Change-Id: Icf5f26397e16d7fbfae77aa246ac5e35581f441e
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Use unittest.mock instead of third party mock

Now that we no longer support py27, we can use the standard library
unittest.mock module instead of the third party mock lib.

Change-Id: Ic767e59531bc2515cc1c20675792fe88300e3f30
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

generate translation files without them.

The overcloud_upgrade_roles.yaml playbook was refactored to take
care of upgrading all the roles within the file. Therefore, there
is no need to iteratively call to it passing oc_roles. If we do,
we would be upgrading the whole environment multiple times.

Also, as the loop is removed we can change the import from an
include_tasks into import_tasks.

Change-Id: Ie2f7263e8c8844fd040dd42755dc010cc70816b1
(cherry picked from commit 7f83cfcddbcac53919c30fb78efdfc57af7248fe)
'}]
commit_message:
Remove loop for overcloud_upgrade_roles.yaml.

The overcloud_upgrade_roles.yaml playbook was refactored to take
care of upgrading all the roles within the file. Therefore, there
is no need to iteratively call to it passing oc_roles. If we do,
we would be upgrading the whole environment multiple times.

Also, as the loop is removed we can change the import from an
include_tasks into import_tasks.

Change-Id: Ie2f7263e8c8844fd040dd42755dc010cc70816b1
(cherry picked from commit 7f83cfcddbcac53919c30fb78efdfc57af7248fe)

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

Set openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I5ebcae5db6b0f9f4dbf0754ace544b6c1e341ec7

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-25 16:15:39.000000000', 'message': 'Add Skip RHEL enforcement to Undercloud Upgrade Tasks

Adding skip_rhel_enforcement related task broke downstream CI testing as
undercloud upgrade/update tries to verify RHEL and fails. The flag was
intended for updates, but as Undercloud upgrade and update share the same
code [0] we also need the flag set to false.
This patch adds RHEL verification to FFWD as well as normal upgrade
tasks to fix undercloud upgrade as well as "overcloud upgrade prepare"

[0] - I076bebf6bbd5f45d5ecb372a3b83e8cc279946b8

Change-Id: Ica692fd82dba73e2b1f62b0ee02cc925f4df786f
(cherry picked from commit ad3af549a1234cf4f21e16206d8c0d47ba8f116a)
'}]
commit_message:
Add Skip RHEL enforcement to Undercloud Upgrade Tasks

Adding skip_rhel_enforcement related task broke downstream CI testing as
undercloud upgrade/update tries to verify RHEL and fails. The flag was
intended for updates, but as Undercloud upgrade and update share the same
code [0] we also need the flag set to false.
This patch adds RHEL verification to FFWD as well as normal upgrade
tasks to fix undercloud upgrade as well as "overcloud upgrade prepare"

[0] - I076bebf6bbd5f45d5ecb372a3b83e8cc279946b8

Change-Id: Ica692fd82dba73e2b1f62b0ee02cc925f4df786f
(cherry picked from commit ad3af549a1234cf4f21e16206d8c0d47ba8f116a)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-14 12:24:16.000000000', 'message': 'Remove translation sections from setup.cfg

These translation sections are not needed anymore, Babel can
generate translation files without them.

Change-Id: Ia6ecc1334c209ee7934128046bf5bb451c371faf
'}]
commit_message:
Remove translation sections from setup.cfg

These translation sections are not needed anymore, Babel can
generate translation files without them.

Change-Id: Ia6ecc1334c209ee7934128046bf5bb451c371faf

commit_message:
pre-install: use path and drop dest

We have a few checks that depend on the value of path and
dest is an alias of path anyways so we should just always
use path instead.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/729844
Change-Id: I38ed2b120ece1268ccfe519c94bda038571a99b7
(cherry picked from commit bbbbd94101cd3d34e64f4b9b7a4dd88c152cac2f)

subject: Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions
messages: [{'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-05-21 18:27:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2020-05-25 08:43:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2020-05-26 09:51:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-21 18:27:22.000000000', 'message': "Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file. Note that
the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org
where the PDF file is placed in the top-level html directory. The
site-preview places the PDF in a pdf directory.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I5f56bbaec06c86cde15431cad0307a1541377b1e
"}]
commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file. Note that
the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org
where the PDF file is placed in the top-level html directory. The
site-preview places the PDF in a pdf directory.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I5f56bbaec06c86cde15431cad0307a1541377b1e

commit_message:
Add timeout and retries to JSON RPC client

The necessary options are already in keystoneauth, but have empty
defaults. This patch changes timeout to 15 and adds 2 retries by default.

Change-Id: Idf8cfa54b77be6f5127d2c9d587a427aa0898802
(cherry picked from commit 14524c265b4104bf9cf4eeeae21fbb1eca2cecbc)

commit_message:
Fix hacking min version to 3.0.1

flake8 new release 3.8.0 added new checks and gate pep8
job start failing. hacking 3.0.1 fix the pinning of flake8 to
avoid bringing in a new version with new checks.
refer:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014828.html

Change-Id: Ife4938b6da860041b99fee37981e7de010c981f8

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file. Note that
the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org
where the PDF file is placed in the top-level html directory. The
site-preview places the PDF in a pdf directory.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file. Note that
the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org
where the PDF file is placed in the top-level html directory. The
site-preview places the PDF in a pdf directory.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I20ea481c1dd9651258b8ae13da9b1e1ec710482b

[{'created': '2019-06-11 20:56:56.000000000', 'message': 'get_ksa_adapter: nix by-service-type confgrp hack

get_ksa_adapter was set up [1] to look for KSA config values in a config
section named after the *project* for the service type.

When Placement was set up to use get_ksa_adapter [2], Placement was part
of the Nova project, so get_ksa_adapter needed to be hacked to look for
KSA config values in the [placement] section rather than the [nova]
section.

Now that Placement has been extracted, this hack is no longer necessary,
because the "project" for placement is placement.

So this commit a) bumps os-service-types to 1.4.0 where placement was
updated to point to its own project; and b) removes the workaround from
get_ksa_adapter since it's no longer needed.

[1] If625411f40be0ba642baeb02950f568f43673655
[2] I69e9b30d96390a70198b12d74e7efa9bd61db217

commit_message:
get_ksa_adapter: nix by-service-type confgrp hack

get_ksa_adapter was set up [1] to look for KSA config values in a config
section named after the *project* for the service type.

When Placement was set up to use get_ksa_adapter [2], Placement was part
of the Nova project, so get_ksa_adapter needed to be hacked to look for
KSA config values in the [placement] section rather than the [nova]
section.

Now that Placement has been extracted, this hack is no longer necessary,
because the "project" for placement is placement.

So this commit removes the workaround from get_ksa_adapter since it's no
longer needed.

[1] If625411f40be0ba642baeb02950f568f43673655
[2] I69e9b30d96390a70198b12d74e7efa9bd61db217

Change-Id: I72c5bbe39da5907679d3fb7e72faac903601873c

For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI, add a review comment with run-Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI

- nova http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/728766/1 : FAILURE in 10m 25s'}, {'account_id': 31916, 'date': '2020-05-18 09:50:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2020-05-18 10:00:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI, add a review comment with run-Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI

- nova http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/728766/2 : FAILURE in 9m 17s'}, {'account_id': 31916, 'date': '2020-05-19 06:44:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2020-05-19 06:55:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI, add a review comment with run-Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI

- nova http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/728766/3 : FAILURE in 9m 53s'}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2020-05-19 14:24:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

Hi Vinay,

thanks for the patch! In OpenStack the bug-fixing process [1] requires to 
* always fix a bug in master (if it is applicable there)
* and backport the bugfix branch-by-branch

In this case the document should be updated in master in openstack/placement first (because this Placement became a separate project with Stein release). Whenever the update is merged in master, it can be backported to stable/ussuri branch.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/project-team-guide/stable-branches.html#processes'}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2020-05-25 14:09:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> But in master branch i didn't find the placement API port error and
> there is no need to change from stein version to present current
> version . And this bug was found in pike, queens, rocky only and for
> these there  is no seperate openstack/placemnt project , steps were
> included in "Install and Configure controller node in openSUSE and
> SUSE Linux Enterprise " doc only.

Hi Vinay,

You are right about the document, that it has changed in Stein (with patch Ib928162702a54f000161367c90172c730cb632c7) so if I understand correctly, your patch is not applicable in Stein, Train, etc.

However the very same document is still in nova in Rocky, so that is the most recent branch where this patch could be added then. In such cases the patch's commit message should explain that this is not applicable in newer branches and that's why it is a stable-only fix.

Whenever the patch has merged in the first applicable branch (rocky in this case) it can be merged back to the next applicable branch (queens), and so on.'}, {'account_id': 31916, 'date': '2020-05-26 10:25:26.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
[Nova] Documentation Error with Placement API Port

In Installing and Configure Controller Node for openSUSE and SUSE Linux
Enterprise Doc, modified the Placement API Service Endpoint port from "8780"
to "8778".

Closes-Bug: #1759839

Change-Id: Ic0427f5cfa5b9bd4f51a09d78904506638dfe9f9

[{'created': '2020-05-23 15:41:04.000000000', 'message': "Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file. Note that
the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org
where the PDF file is placed in the top-level html directory. The
site-preview places the PDF in a pdf directory.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I94ad6c9fde9c681c360f2161e9bb90f7300fd74a
"}]
commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file. Note that
the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org
where the PDF file is placed in the top-level html directory. The
site-preview places the PDF in a pdf directory.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I94ad6c9fde9c681c360f2161e9bb90f7300fd74a

package information to reflect that support.

commit_message:
Update master for stable/ussuri

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/ussuri.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/ussuri.

Sem-Ver: feature

subject: Bump default tox env from py37 to py38
messages: [{'account_id': 29313, 'date': '2020-05-15 17:44:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 29313, 'date': '2020-05-15 17:44:19.000000000', 'content': 'Topic set to py38-tox'}, {'account_id': 15197, 'date': '2020-05-26 09:21:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2020-05-26 09:31:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-15 17:44:00.000000000', 'message': 'Bump default tox env from py37 to py38

Python 3.8 is now our highest level supported python runtime.
This updates the default tox target environments to swap out
py37 for py38 to make sure local development testing is
covering this version.

This does not impact zuul jobs in any way, nor prevent local
tests against py37. It just changes the default if none is
explicitly provided.

Change-Id: Ia8695eb481235043b6aedda2c92aeb7f49a3c00b
'}]
commit_message:
Bump default tox env from py37 to py38

Python 3.8 is now our highest level supported python runtime.
This updates the default tox target environments to swap out
py37 for py38 to make sure local development testing is
covering this version.

This does not impact zuul jobs in any way, nor prevent local
tests against py37. It just changes the default if none is
explicitly provided.

Change-Id: Ia8695eb481235043b6aedda2c92aeb7f49a3c00b

commit_message:
Use default network type during PortTestCasesResourceRequest setup

A vxlan network is created during the resource_setup for class
PortTestCasesResourceRequest, failing when vxlan is not an available
driver
No restriction is needed in provider network type for these tests

Closes-Bug: #1879706

Change-Id: I164c4b7af7c0be00b8e70048e527b469587f0c8d

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-22 17:17:32.000000000', 'message': "Use tox 'all' env instead of 'all-plugins' for networking bgpvpn tempest plugin

networking bgpvpn tempest plugin is in-tree plugin till stein and
used to be run with all-plugins tox env which does not work now for
python2.7 jobs. Temepst venv is installed with py3 and all-plugins
no longer detect the system wide installed tempest plugins.

This commit makes to installed networking bgpvpn as tempest plugins so
that Tempest venv can detect it and run tests with 'all' tox env.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/730378/
Change-Id: Ia281acb40eac38db88c495cbf2ded322a204a0f5
"}, {'created': '2020-05-22 19:26:25.000000000', 'message': "Use tox 'all' env instead of 'all-plugins' for networking bgpvpn tempest plugin

networking bgpvpn tempest plugin is in-tree plugin till stein and
used to be run with all-plugins tox env which does not work now for
python2.7 jobs. Temepst venv is installed with py3 and all-plugins
no longer detect the system wide installed tempest plugins.

This commit makes to installed networking bgpvpn as tempest plugins so
that Tempest venv can detect it and run tests with 'all' tox env.

Closes-Bug: #1880217

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/730378/
Change-Id: Ia281acb40eac38db88c495cbf2ded322a204a0f5

commit_message:
Use tox 'all' env instead of 'all-plugins' for networking bgpvpn tempest plugin

networking bgpvpn tempest plugin is in-tree plugin till stein and
used to be run with all-plugins tox env which does not work now for
python2.7 jobs. Temepst venv is installed with py3 and all-plugins
no longer detect the system wide installed tempest plugins.

This commit makes to installed networking bgpvpn as tempest plugins so
that Tempest venv can detect it and run tests with 'all' tox env.

Closes-Bug: #1880217

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/730378/
Change-Id: Ia281acb40eac38db88c495cbf2ded322a204a0f5

commit_message:
Allow to attach/detach port when vm_state is soft-delete

VM in SOFT_DELETED and SHUTOFF statuses are the same at hypervisor
level. It's allowed to attach/detach port when vm_state is stopped.
So soft-delete should also be allowed.

Closes-bug: #1794683
Change-Id: I7085f35a25bd521b8ca393bbad81c785c5d63935

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-05 22:31:14.000000000', 'message': 'Modified version of 0027-Numa-object-string-representations.patch
with some updates from the current numa files for nova:
numa.py
instance_numa_topology.py

This commit adds __str__ and __repr__ methods to objects
InstanceNUMACell
and NUMACell. These will generate more readable representations of
the objects for use in logs.

The __str__ method has lots of newlines (i.e., per field).
The __repr__ specifically does not print newlines per field, so we
may print one line of output per numa cell. This was deliberate for
resource tracking debug log enhancments (CONF.compute_resource_debug).

Remove comment tags

Removed references to R4/R5 and more...on commit message

Removed L3, physnode, and Shared_vcpu related code

Performed a diff with the master code to determine what sections of
code were not compatible and removed the functions involved.
See commit history for more information on removed code.

Fixed formating around string variables to pass py27 tox requirements.

commit_message:
Add __str__  method to NUMACell related objects

This will generate more readable representations of the objects for
use in logs. The __str__ method has commas to serperate each item
(i.e., per field). This was deliberate for resource tracking debug
log enhancments.

Change-Id: I80b6cc4b525b244440cc56a5e97585d3f038b882
Implements: blueprint improve-sched-logging
Partial-Bug: 1787298

commit_message:
Use correct space binding for live migration

Ensure that the 'migration' network space binding or the fallback
configuration option is passed to the nova-cloud-controller application
so that the correct IP address is SSH host scanned during setup of
live migration between hypervisors.

Change-Id: I6e20cd0b03f564ee9c110cf58fb0466f6a1f6c82
Closes-Bug: 1874235

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-25 08:05:45.000000000', 'message': 'Allow ability for non admin users to use status=DELETED filter on server list

In this patch Ia5504da9a00bad689766aeda20255e10b7629f63, we allowed
non-admin users to use all filters on server list. But we forgot to
allow non-admin user to get servers by status=DELETED. Since
non-admin user can now get deleted servers by --deleted filter, we
should keep the same behavior of status=DELETED filter as --deleted.

Change-Id: I1417c173f9c4d3d0166370bce97ddd846749c57d
Closes-bug: #1737050
'}]
commit_message:
Allow ability for non admin users to use status=DELETED filter on server list

In this patch Ia5504da9a00bad689766aeda20255e10b7629f63, we allowed
non-admin users to use all filters on server list. But we forgot to
allow non-admin user to get servers by status=DELETED. Since
non-admin user can now get deleted servers by --deleted filter, we
should keep the same behavior of status=DELETED filter as --deleted.

Change-Id: I1417c173f9c4d3d0166370bce97ddd846749c57d
Closes-bug: #1737050

commit_message:
Misc fixes for charm infra

Update pydev project definition to use python 3.

Drop upper bound on flake8.

Tidy misc lint across codebase with newer flake8.

[{'account_id': 28203, 'date': '2018-05-10 05:45:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-05-10 05:45:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 28203, 'date': '2018-05-10 05:57:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2018-05-10 07:51:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi Tsuyoshi, in my opinion, I didn't think you needed to split up this patch and the blueprint was the right approach.

We have been discussing about increasing the maximum number of volumes allowed to attach to a single instance and it sounds like we need to have a wider discussion on the openstack-dev and openstack-operators mailing lists about how to move forward. I'm going to send an email to the lists and get more feedback from operators to determine how we should implement this (pick a new hardcoded max vs provide a config option vs provide some kind of API limit that is configurable)."}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2018-06-07 03:50:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 21:

(1 comment)

> I've posted to the dev and ops ML here:
 > 
 > http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-June/131289.html

The original limitation of 26 disks was because at that time there was no 'virtio-scsi' — where the 'virtio' controller allows upto 256 targets.

FWIW, the upstream libguestfs project limits the number of disks to 256 (and suggest for Nova the same).  And if anyone wants to increase it, the proposer should come with a full worked through test plan :-)"}, {'account_id': 6962, 'date': '2018-06-08 08:23:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

We will see where the discussion goes there. If the spec is approved, we can use Tsuyoshi's other patch as part of the work items, if it's applicable."}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2020-05-26 09:07:26.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

Also this patch is stale. So I'm abandoning it. If you disagree please ping me (gibi) on IRC."}]

'}, {'created': '2018-06-05 00:09:28.000000000', 'message': "openstack server add volume fails over 26vols

Adding 27th volumes to a instance allways fails.

$ openstack server add volume sles15rc vol27
Unexpected API Error. Please report this at http://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/ and attach the Nova API log if possible.
<class 'NovaException_Remote'> (HTTP 500) (Request-ID: req-d95fea94-31fe-4063-9262-a84088cbaf29)

Current implementation, nova's find_disk_dev_for_disk_bus()
selects only a character, like sda ... sdz (26vols).

This fix helps more than 26 volumes to attach an instance.

*TODO*
  get_dev_count_for_disk_bus(bustype) returns device limit
  number by various bus type(ide=4, scsi=256, virtio=...).
   It should be fix by more discussion.

Change-Id: I227b11d9ec0c2aebaeb0366fd731f829f21f1ca2
Closes-Bug: #1770527
"}, {'created': '2018-06-07 02:15:13.000000000', 'message': "Define nova's max number of devices by each bus-type.

Attating volumes to an instance are failed over 26 volumes.
There is 2 problems in nova's implementation.
This provides 1sts solution, or needs more discussion.

*1) Define nova's max number of devices by each bus-type.
      26 -> ???
     review#567472

 2) Fix nova can handle device name length more widly for universally.
    not only under 26. like
       vda(index=0), sdb(index=1),
       vdaa(index=), sdabc(index=), vdfxshrxx(index=INT_MAX)
     review#573066

2nd's are another patch.

Change-Id: I227b11d9ec0c2aebaeb0366fd731f829f21f1ca2
Implements: blueprint nova-improvement-of-maximum-attach-volumes-more-than-26-vols

commit_message:
[nova] increasing the number of allowed volumes attached per instance > 26

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-June/131289.html

This patch selecting a new, higher maximum number of limitation
      26 -> ???
     review#567472

Another patch is the nova can handle device name length more widely for
universally.
  see the   review#573066

Change-Id: I227b11d9ec0c2aebaeb0366fd731f829f21f1ca2
Implements: blueprint nova-improvement-of-maximum-attach-volumes-more-than-26-vols

commit_message:
Revert "Update OPENSTACK_RELEASE to ussuri"

Ussuri release. Standard process per [1].

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/kolla/latest/contributor/release-management.html

This reverts commit 4e41d1416e6a4d4296b4b27f447e58973b34a9c4.

Change-Id: I45251e80aadaab3f2a540c17e8e60b086f1adfa5

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-25 08:37:19.000000000', 'message': 'Raise BuildAbortException while updating instance task_state conflict

There is an edge case that conflict updating instance task_state
after _build_resources, then we will terminate instance and reschedule
to another host.

IMO, this uxpected task state should aborts the build and not
reschedule.

Change-Id: I68e61a18b5860c782c92d028e97f2f767f3b5483
Closes-Bug: #1813255
'}, {'created': '2019-01-27 13:30:11.000000000', 'message': 'Raise BuildAbortException while updating instance task_state conflict

There is an edge case that conflict updating instance task_state
after _build_resources, then we will terminate instance and reschedule
to another host.

IMO, this uxpected task state should aborts the build and not
reschedule.

Change-Id: I68e61a18b5860c782c92d028e97f2f767f3b5483

commit_message:
Raise BuildAbortException while updating instance task_state conflict

There is an edge case that conflict updating instance task_state
after _build_resources, then we will terminate instance and reschedule
to another host.

IMO, this uxpected task state should aborts the build and not
reschedule.

Change-Id: I68e61a18b5860c782c92d028e97f2f767f3b5483
Partial-Bug: #1813255

commit_message:
Remove neutron from tempest_plugins

Pulling the neutron repo into tempest is unnecessary since tests
are run using the neutron-tempest-plugin or repo-specific plugins.
This patch removes neutron from tempest_plugins.

Change-Id: I6176c17b7261fecbca82452b7d4ad2a2c5cdeeb6

subject: Execute kvm-setup inside nova_libvirt container
messages: [{'account_id': 23078, 'date': '2020-05-13 19:12:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2020-05-14 15:32:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 18575, 'date': '2020-05-26 05:05:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-13 19:12:39.000000000', 'message': "Execute kvm-setup inside nova_libvirt container

On POWER8 (and some others), kvm requires some additional setup before
VMs can be successfully run. There is a script to perform this setup,
but it is provided as a systemd service -- we don't have systemd inside
containers, so let's include the invocation of the script in the
definition of the container.

Change-Id: I1e7208e4bd1c7f0c87354b6f6963c0d2df86cc02
Closes-Bug: #1878048
(cherry picked from commit 3873d3607542b46d7cd709e4a980888334e6132f)
"}]
commit_message:
Execute kvm-setup inside nova_libvirt container

On POWER8 (and some others), kvm requires some additional setup before
VMs can be successfully run. There is a script to perform this setup,
but it is provided as a systemd service -- we don't have systemd inside
containers, so let's include the invocation of the script in the
definition of the container.

Change-Id: I1e7208e4bd1c7f0c87354b6f6963c0d2df86cc02
Closes-Bug: #1878048
(cherry picked from commit 3873d3607542b46d7cd709e4a980888334e6132f)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-26 07:08:13.000000000', 'message': 'Fix hacking min version to 3.0.1

flake8 new release 3.8.0 added new checks and gate pep8
job start failing. hacking 3.0.1 fix the pinning of flake8 to
avoid bringing in a new version with new checks.

Though it is fixed in latest hacking but 2.0 and 3.0 has cap for
flake8 as <4.0.0 which mean flake8 new version 3.9.0 can also
break the pep8 job if new check are added.

To avoid similar gate break in future, we need to bump the hacking min
version.

'}]
commit_message:
Fix hacking min version to 3.0.1

flake8 new release 3.8.0 added new checks and gate pep8
job start failing. hacking 3.0.1 fix the pinning of flake8 to
avoid bringing in a new version with new checks.

Though it is fixed in latest hacking but 2.0 and 3.0 has cap for
flake8 as <4.0.0 which mean flake8 new version 3.9.0 can also
break the pep8 job if new check are added.

To avoid similar gate break in future, we need to bump the hacking min
version.

- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014828.html

Change-Id: Ia50eaefdfc44dab125add16019fd1efa838d0449

commit_message:
Add cache prefetcher interval configuration option

As new periodic job added in glance which will run as per
interval set using 'cache_prefetcher_interval' configuration
option and fetch images which are queued for caching in cache
directory.

Enabled 'cache_prefetcher_interval' configuration option
in glance-api.conf.

Change-Id: I8ece28a9b0c6f104130d817490e9ea4c2b4e7808

commit_message:
Bump hacking min version to 3.0.1

flake8 new release 3.8.0 added new checks and gate pep8
job start failing. hacking 3.0.1 fix the pinning of flake8 to
avoid bringing in a new version with new checks.

Though it is fixed in latest hacking but 2.0 and 3.0 has cap for
flake8 as <4.0.0 which mean flake8 new version 3.9.0 can also
break the pep8 job if new check are added.

To avoid similar gate break in future, we need to bump the hacking min
version.

- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014828.html

Change-Id: I2a903c90d72cd596ef976d9aab478f96a2750680

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-21 11:10:09.000000000', 'message': "Switch to newer openstackdocstheme version

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 version. Using
this version will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file. Note that
the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org
where the PDF file is placed in the top-level html directory. The
site-preview places the PDF in a pdf directory.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

Remove docs requirements from lower-constraints, they are not needed
during install or test but only for docs building.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I9dfa47d28d3f76115d6cf6dd86ea04d621d99c65
"}, {'created': '2020-05-25 13:36:38.000000000', 'message': "Switch to newer openstackdocstheme version

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme version

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 version. Using
this version will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file. Note that
the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org
where the PDF file is placed in the top-level html directory. The
site-preview places the PDF in a pdf directory.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I9dfa47d28d3f76115d6cf6dd86ea04d621d99c65

commit_message:
Fix pygments style

New docs theme (Victoria+) respects pygments_style. Since we start using
Victoria requirements while being on Ussuri, this patch ensures proper
rendering both in Ussuri and Victoria.

Change-Id: If43d09c8a3510ab8db9e7c613fd504028d0ff011

subject: Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions
messages: [{'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-05-21 11:58:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14107, 'date': '2020-05-26 01:24:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1\n\nThanks'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-21 11:58:43.000000000', 'message': "Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file. Note that
the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org
where the PDF file is placed in the top-level html directory. The
site-preview places the PDF in a pdf directory.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: Ieaaff8278e93f85bd711a340f9621ae18841e720
"}]
commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file. Note that
the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org
where the PDF file is placed in the top-level html directory. The
site-preview places the PDF in a pdf directory.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: Ieaaff8278e93f85bd711a340f9621ae18841e720

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I3b5249bee4f8452cc3a717dc93d2eca70002ce59

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Remove docs requirements from lower-constraints, they are not needed
during install or test but only for docs building.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I6023bc3767c5aaae90be1c5434d024e9ed76e737

commit_message:
Revert "nova shared storage: rbd is always shared storage"

This reverts commit 05b7f63a42e3512da6fe45d2e6639fb47ed8102b.

The _is_storage_shared_with method is specifically checking if the
instance directory is shared. It is not checking if the actual instance
disks are shared and as a result assumptions cannot be made based on the
value of images_type.

Closes-Bug: 1824858
Change-Id: I52293b6ce3e1ce77fa31b382d0067fb3bc68b21f
(cherry picked from commit 404932f82130445472837095b3ad9089c75e2660)
(cherry picked from commit 890882ebbf74db14a7c1904cca96cd7f5907493b)
(cherry picked from commit a63c97fd2d13de532330523587894163e32a892f)
(cherry picked from commit 44609c5847dfe591caf3f40497f1abc7c7aa7384)

commit_message:
Avoid using introspection start delays with non-managed boot

When boot is managed by the ironic side, a node is powered on
right after starting introspection. Inspector's own delays play
no role and may actually prevent introspectin from happening if
a node boots faster than it's whitelisted in the PXE filter.

This changes moves the delay handling later in the process and
only does it when manage_boot is True.

Conflicts:
	ironic_inspector/test/unit/test_introspect.py

Change-Id: If7de8b66ea42eff2966c62a9a0529ab9a5c06f26
Story: #2007658
Task: #39745
(cherry picked from commit 3d1bf55b3594b3ea35febd003131d118139f2200)

commit_message:
Add sg name in after delete event kwargs

Allow the subscriber to know the deleted security group name. It can
help some downstream callback utilization to use the deleted sg name for
additional workflow.

Change-Id: Ia321ff96cf445d20f082779d3f6a96fac07b0943
(cherry picked from commit a2561fa480c28a8bbcbe0528c5a72bc98a9e2a22)

[{'created': '2020-04-17 17:58:11.000000000', 'message': "Stop configuring install_command in tox.

Currently, we are overriding 'install_command' to use 'pip'. This is
considered poor behavior and 'python -m pip' should be used instead:

https://snarky.ca/why-you-should-use-python-m-pip/

It turns out that this is the the default value provided by tox:

https://tox.readthedocs.io/en/latest/config.html#conf-install_command

So we can remove the line and simply use the default value.

openstack-discuss thread
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-April/014237.html

Change-Id: I849342bd077ab2f8bbda4e0a228c308eb7a4908b

commit_message:
Stop configuring install_command in tox.

Currently, we are overriding 'install_command' to use 'pip'. This is
considered poor behavior and 'python -m pip' should be used instead:

https://snarky.ca/why-you-should-use-python-m-pip/

It turns out that this is the the default value provided by tox:

https://tox.readthedocs.io/en/latest/config.html#conf-install_command

So we can remove the line and simply use the default value.

openstack-discuss thread
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-April/014237.html

Bumping requirements and l-c with:
keystoneauth1 3.18.0
alembic 0.9.6
pika 0.10.0 (necessary for installation)
Change-Id: I849342bd077ab2f8bbda4e0a228c308eb7a4908b

commit_message:
Include tripleo_ceph_workdir role on rgw variables override

This change includes the ceph_workdir prepare role to make
sure the ceph_rgw_config_overrides variable is set in the
same block where the task which builds the global overrides
executes.

Co-Authored-By: Giulio Fidente <gfidente@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I68690e87e678b6ad31fce37cc352083251083927
Closes-Bug: 1879938
(cherry picked from commit a9ab369898725a2a1451a8394dab2b21fb1bf5fb)

[{'created': '2020-05-25 08:48:21.000000000', 'message': 'Make user value for GlanceImageImportPlugin prevail on logic

We used to *append* image_conversion to the list of enabled Glance
import plugins when both Glance and Nova were configured to use RBD
but we should instead make user input prevail on the logic, assuming
users who customize the THT param know what they are doing and
eventually include image_conversion only when they need it.

Change-Id: I5c0788bb361323f5a0e69e22d4bd42fa3c1e06ed
(cherry picked from commit fe4253102a3ae73b125c75c9f4c51d82ddad7bbb)
'}]
commit_message:
Make user value for GlanceImageImportPlugin prevail on logic

We used to *append* image_conversion to the list of enabled Glance
import plugins when both Glance and Nova were configured to use RBD
but we should instead make user input prevail on the logic, assuming
users who customize the THT param know what they are doing and
eventually include image_conversion only when they need it.

Change-Id: I5c0788bb361323f5a0e69e22d4bd42fa3c1e06ed
(cherry picked from commit fe4253102a3ae73b125c75c9f4c51d82ddad7bbb)

is not compatible with fedora-coreos distro required to be used nowadays

commit_message:
Fix CI job

* Fix pep8: ambiguous variable name
* Install Python 3.7 for trove guest image. oslo.concurrency requires
  python 3.6 or newer. See
  https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1861803
* Mark tempest job non-voting temporarily because of some tempest bugs.

Change-Id: I6d316779cc7220a855ce187437056b667bbe1f75

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-13 20:49:06.000000000', 'message': "[ceph-osd, ceph-client] Weight OSDs as they are added

Currently OSDs are added by the ceph-osd chart with zero weight
and they get reweighted to proper weights in the ceph-client chart
after all OSDs have been deployed. This causes a problem when a
deployment is partially completed and additional OSDs are added
later. In this case the ceph-client chart has already run and the
new OSDs don't ever get weighted correctly. This change weights
OSDs properly as they are deployed instead. As noted in the
script, the noin flag may be set during the deployment to prevent
rebalancing as OSDs are added if necessary.

Change-Id: Iac50352c857d874f3956776c733d09e0034a0285
"}, {'created': '2020-05-13 20:51:20.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] [ceph-osd, ceph-client] Weight OSDs as they are added

later. In this case the ceph-client chart has already run and the
new OSDs don't ever get weighted correctly. This change weights
OSDs properly as they are deployed instead. As noted in the
script, the noin flag may be set during the deployment to prevent
rebalancing as OSDs are added if necessary.

Change-Id: Iac50352c857d874f3956776c733d09e0034a0285

Change-Id: Iac50352c857d874f3956776c733d09e0034a0285

after all OSDs have been deployed. This causes a problem when a
deployment is partially completed and additional OSDs are added
later. In this case the ceph-client chart has already run and the
new OSDs don't ever get weighted correctly. This change weights
OSDs properly as they are deployed instead. As noted in the
script, the noin flag may be set during the deployment to prevent

commit_message:
[ceph-osd, ceph-client] Weight OSDs as they are added

Currently OSDs are added by the ceph-osd chart with zero weight
and they get reweighted to proper weights in the ceph-client chart
after all OSDs have been deployed. This causes a problem when a
deployment is partially completed and additional OSDs are added
later. In this case the ceph-client chart has already run and the
new OSDs don't ever get weighted correctly. This change weights
OSDs properly as they are deployed instead. As noted in the
script, the noin flag may be set during the deployment to prevent
rebalancing as OSDs are added if necessary.

Added the ability to set and unset Ceph cluster flags in the
ceph-client chart.

Change-Id: Iac50352c857d874f3956776c733d09e0034a0285

commit_message:
Add Centos-8 support

Make hardening compatible with CentOS-8. Dependant patch [1] already
passes hardening and another one resolves issue with installing
non-existent packages. So we should merge this one without passing
CentOS 8 tests not to create circular dependency

[1] https://review.opendev.org/689629

Change-Id: I33160b9a6e8331d6db39824e420033c7ab06780b

commit_message:
Do not include vendordata class in nova::compute

Currently vendordata class is only included in nova-compute, but
this is inconsistent because the class is not included in nova-api
and nova-metadata-api, which also require vendordata configuration.

This patch removes automatical inclusion of vendordata class from
compute class, so that we are consistent about the inclusion of
vendordata class.

Change-Id: Ib2100f419afa80fd482404b0b3606e9c11d47ab5

commit_message:
Refer log_level parameter in console log handler

Previously while log_level parameter is referred for file handler and
rsyslog handler, it was not used for console handler.
This patch makes sure that the log_level parameter is also effective
for console logger, so that the parameter results in the same behavior
for all log handlers.

Change-Id: I2e8195379f3805a929bc81f99a4f33d934362d5b

commit_message:
Remove post_config from the Kibana role

Since at least Stein, there is no visible effect from these tasks.
The Kibana dashboard seems to be working exactly the same,
greeting user on the first use with "please configure my index".
I tested on both Ubuntu and CentOS.
In new E*K stack (Ussuri+, CentOS8+) it even causes play errors.

Co-authored-by: Radosław Piliszek <radoslaw.piliszek@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Iafc6986cce9cbaa0ea9e219ca85d7d01a61308cf
Closes-Bug: #1799689
(cherry picked from commit fbc47e60e1ce0f371c3f9e4350d5581c98d7b393)
(cherry picked from commit aea9b4d23367d4d0d8094f49584b537f13b86c6c)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-27 16:24:56.000000000', 'message': 'Add retries to sending emails

We have occasional release announcement job failures due to network
issues or other SMTP errors sending the announcement. Most of these
appear to be temporary failures that would be resolved with another
attempt.

This patch adds exponential backoff retries to the sending process to
try to get around these failures.

Change-Id: I70bb470639385caecee7ccfc0e449449bfc9b871
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Add retries to sending emails

We have occasional release announcement job failures due to network
issues or other SMTP errors sending the announcement. Most of these
appear to be temporary failures that would be resolved with another
attempt.

This patch adds exponential backoff retries to the sending process to
try to get around these failures.

Change-Id: I70bb470639385caecee7ccfc0e449449bfc9b871
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
[OVN][metadata] Adding ERROR trace upon unexpected data

When a metadata request arrives to the metadata agent, OVN
will need to figure out which port it corresponds to and it'll do
based on the network ID and IP address which should be a unique pair.

If it's not unique or it doesn't exist, then there is an error
and an ERROR trace is logged.

Change-Id: Id83c2899a03af98e32b0be7ba6ad661e646f07bc
Related-Bug: 1874733
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from Neutron commit 591adfee971906dc86e9357903f164d01657ed65)

commit_message:
[OVN][metadata] Adding ERROR trace upon unexpected data

When a metadata request arrives to the metadata agent, OVN
will need to figure out which port it corresponds to and it'll do
based on the network ID and IP address which should be a unique pair.

If it's not unique or it doesn't exist, then there is an error
and an ERROR trace is logged.

Change-Id: Id83c2899a03af98e32b0be7ba6ad661e646f07bc
Related-Bug: 1874733
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from Neutron commit 591adfee971906dc86e9357903f164d01657ed65)

commit_message:
[OVN][metadata] Adding ERROR trace upon unexpected data

When a metadata request arrives to the metadata agent, OVN
will need to figure out which port it corresponds to and it'll do
based on the network ID and IP address which should be a unique pair.

If it's not unique or it doesn't exist, then there is an error
and an ERROR trace is logged.

Change-Id: Id83c2899a03af98e32b0be7ba6ad661e646f07bc
Related-Bug: 1874733
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from Neutron commit 591adfee971906dc86e9357903f164d01657ed65)

commit_message:
Appoint Javier Peña as rpm-packaging PTL

Javier has accepted to be PTL while we are determining the way
forward for PTL-less projects.

The rpm-packaging doesn't desire to change its practices for
releasing (as it currently owns renderspec and pymod2pkg),
nor does it desire to move to a new repo by being out of
the OpenStack namespaces.

They don't ask much, just to stay alive. (Insert popular song here).

This is a good solution, until we figure out how this team
can become a PTL-less team.

Change-Id: Ia0e6abe463390f8a13757534cdbca79a2d7c58eb

commit_message:
Require PTL signoff for project-update changes

We should not allow changes to a project unless someone from the project
(e.g. the PTL or their delegate) agrees to the change.

Change-Id: I9e52035da299d7ae3e55e4636d0a1c66ca3c2e36
Signed-off-by: Graham Hayes <gr@ham.ie>

commit_message:
Allow for faster addition of projects

We have a huge timeout right now for the addition of new projects to a
team which is just slowing things down for usually no reason.  This aims
at speeding up the process by replacing the current one-week waiting
period with a need for only two roll-call +1 votes.

We can always revert additions if they don't make sense.

Change-Id: I4a88916f81699a343812c8e01f7419d33cab1ac3

Retire syntribos

These three repos are now retired, remove them from sigs-repos list.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/726506

subject: Remove CentOS 8 from tested runtimes for Ussuri
