messages:
[{'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2020-04-14 15:16:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-04-14 15:20:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Should we change this to CentOS 7? Otherwise, this is making it look like we don't test any Red Hat based distros anymore."}, {'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2020-04-14 15:21:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

We don't test for Ussuri. I believe stable/ussuri Devstack does not support CentOS 7 + Python 3 either."}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2020-04-14 15:21:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Sean - I think the truth is "we don't"'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2020-04-14 15:21:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

I think being explicit about the true state of the world is important.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-04-14 15:23:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

> Sean - I think the truth is "we don't"

I didn't realize this. Then yes, we should be explicit about what is actually tested.'}, {'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2020-04-14 15:26:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

For reference, this is the WIP patch for CentOS 8 support in devstack: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/688614/'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2020-04-14 15:33:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

So it's *less* tested than openSUSE Leap 15?"}, {'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2020-04-14 15:35:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> So it's *less* tested than openSUSE Leap 15?

If devstack can deploy an OpenStack cloud on openSUSE Leap 15 without workarounds, then the answer I guess is "yes, less".'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2020-04-14 15:56:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

That was really my question. Do we currently run DevStack tests of proposed changes for OpenStack projects on openSUSE Leap 15 either?'}, {'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2020-04-14 15:58:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/builds?job_name=devstack-platform-opensuse-15'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2020-04-14 16:19:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Thanks for confirming. Looks like that only tests changes o DevStack itself, but it's at least a form of post-merge integration testing for the other projects covered by the job, and seems to include some limited number of Tempest tests so it's more than just "do the services start?"'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2020-04-14 19:58:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Honestly I don't think support in [1] is that far off.  The patch isn't too big, and has passed testing at least once.

The crux of the matter is really the RDO repos we are adding with [2].  It is as much a test of them as centos8.  Do we want to (keep) doing this?  I don't know.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/688614
[2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/688614/32/stack.sh"}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2020-04-14 20:12:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Could we not rely on the signal published by the TripleO team?'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2020-04-14 20:14:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

My main concern is that Train was the last set of packages published for CentOS 7 and CentOS 8.

https://blogs.rdoproject.org/2020/02/migration-paths-for-rdo-from-centos-7-to-8/

Now, I don't know if you count RDO as a distro or a packager that helps make OpenStack accessible (Ubuntu does have an unfair advantage in that it gets used all the time by default).  But that certainly puts those users in a bad place *technically*.

I would have loved if we raised this earlier rather than now..."}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2020-04-15 07:24:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

I am not against that, but I think it's time to end this "supported distributions" list soon. However, I don't expect this to be retro-active, so it might be worth doing in another governance patch.

I am okay with the current state of the patch, though a little sad. I will wait for more inputs before updating my vote to its rollcall value: I think this needs more eyes.'}, {'account_id': 16312, 'date': '2020-04-15 10:10:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Honestly I don't think support in [1] is that far off.  The patch
 > isn't too big, and has passed testing at least once.
 > 
 > The crux of the matter is really the RDO repos we are adding with
 > [2].  It is as much a test of them as centos8.  Do we want to
 > (keep) doing this?  I don't know.
 > 
 > [1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/688614
 > [2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/688614/32/stack.sh

What is needed in terms of RDO repos? we will push packages for CentOS8 to official repos very soon (hopefully a couple of days) and will provide a rdo-release rpm to enable the repos. Would that be enough to unblock?"}, {'account_id': 9592, 'date': '2020-04-15 18:59:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Does tripleo support for CentOS-8 count here? Perhaps an asterisk would be more informative?

* CentOS-8 ( tripleo only) 
OR
* CentOS-8 ( devstack not supported )'}, {'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2020-04-15 19:16:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

There is no clear definition of what qualifies a runtime as a "tested runtime" (please correct me if I'm wrong) but an educated guess would be support in devstack for a minimal deployment at the very least. Support in Devstack enables (core) OpenStack services to test basic functionality against a given "tested" runtime should projects want to -- testing against a specific runtime is optional, yes, but not providing a way for projects to test is a blocker.'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2020-04-15 20:12:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Actually there is, it says right here:

https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html#linux-distributions

Each project should run some functional tests on these platforms so we make sure OpenStack works with distros used in production. The scope of these functional tests are discussed for every project, and may adjust their coverage depending of resources and support investment. These tests are run by using existing tooling, which comes with a reasonable expectation that it’s viable on the indicated distributions.

Sometimes, these distributions might not support all dependencies required by new features in OpenStack. Development of these features should not be blocked, though it has to be documented in project release notes, and some tests might have to be skipped on these distributions.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2020-04-15 23:11:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> we will push packages for CentOS8 to official repos very soon (hopefully a couple of days) and will provide a rdo-release rpm to enable the repos. Would that be enough to unblock?

Yes, a release of these packages is what I've personally been waiting for to move this out of WIP.  This at least brings it back inline with what was used for centos6 and 7 historically."}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2020-04-16 12:47:28.000000000', 'content': 'Topic set to formal-vote'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2020-04-20 15:18:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote-1

The RDO community is a close one to us, let's work things out together with them.  I'm happy to drive this quickly.

The (sad) reality though, is really most projects are just testing against Ubuntu, so it's a bit unfair that all their work will not really be used to test against more targets in the community, so alienating them for no reason doesn't feel right."}, {'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2020-04-20 15:22:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> The RDO community is a close one to us, let's work things out
 > together with them.  I'm happy to drive this quickly.
 > 
 > The (sad) reality though, is really most projects are just testing
 > against Ubuntu, so it's a bit unfair that all their work will not
 > really be used to test against more targets in the community, so
 > alienating them for no reason doesn't feel right.

Ussuri Devstack does not support CentOS 8 and we're past feature freeze. How should projects test against CentOS 8 on stable/ussuri and users/developers test on CentOS 8?"}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2020-04-20 19:46:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Ussuri Devstack does not support CentOS 8 and we're past feature
 > freeze. How should projects test against CentOS 8 on stable/ussuri
 > and users/developers test on CentOS 8?

Our upstream CI is not testing our projects against OpenSUSE and CentOS 7 either.  It is quite literally possible that every single piece of OpenStack is broken inside both and we'd never be the wiser.

All we need is to get DevStack to work.  I'm going to drive this.  If a project isn't testing against CentOS 8 or a feature doesn't work, then we need to re-evaluate and start testing against _all_ of our target operating systems, because maybe it doesn't even work against OpenSUSE either."}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2020-04-20 19:47:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

It's passing here: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/688614/"}, {'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2020-04-20 19:53:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> It's passing here: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/688614/

Correct. That is master and will be available from Victoria."}, {'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2020-04-20 19:57:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> > Ussuri Devstack does not support CentOS 8 and we're past feature
 > > freeze. How should projects test against CentOS 8 on
 > stable/ussuri
 > > and users/developers test on CentOS 8?
 > 
 > Our upstream CI is not testing our projects against OpenSUSE and
 > CentOS 7 either.  It is quite literally possible that every single
 > piece of OpenStack is broken inside both and we'd never be the
 > wiser.

Not testing against CentOS 7 because it's not in the "Tested Runtimes" list, plus no support for Python 3. openSUSE is tested and gives us some confidence it works for at least a minimal set of features from projects like Nova, Neutron, Keystone, Glance and Cinder:

- https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/builds?job_name=devstack-platform-opensuse-15.
- https://22dafa932966946580c1-ab66e702835932941e7e8df246c29428.ssl.cf5.rackcdn.com/700814/7/check/devstack-platform-opensuse-15/c29dce3/testr_results.html'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2020-04-20 20:09:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Carlos Goncalves wrote:

> > It's passing here: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/688614/
>
> Correct. That is master and will be available from Victoria.

DevStack hasn't branched stable/ussuri yet, so that *could* be in Ussuri if it merged now (projects generally won't be getting RC1 tags until at least Thursday)."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-04-20 20:13:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I think in the past we were fine because actual deployment tools used CentOS. So "works in Devstack" was not the deciding factor. It was whether any existing tests actually ran the services on CentOS and ran tests.

Is that still the case?'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2020-05-10 17:44:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

https://review.opendev.org/#/q/project:openstack/devstack+topic:centos8+is:open

Can we land those and just avoid having to drop an _extremely_ popular run-time used by some of our biggest clouds?'}, {'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2020-05-10 17:56:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

FWIW, there were at least two occasions where backporting distro support was proposed and not approved:

- https://review.opendev.org/#/c/324295/
- https://review.opendev.org/#/c/149602/'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2020-05-10 17:58:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Sure.  That happened ~5 years ago and ~4 years ago.

We can all agree that we can change things if they make sense for our users.'}, {'account_id': 7198, 'date': '2020-05-11 16:14:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote-1

It seems that this needs more discussion.'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2020-05-11 17:15:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I am not at all confident to say OpenStack work on Centos* or openSUSE* without any testing on projects side. Devstack testing only 5-6 service does not mean all OpenStack services work on those distro. 

We really need to add testing on projects side first before listing them as tested distro. I do not know what to do for ussuri as this was same situation for train, stein or any other older release. 

My proposal is let's keep it as it is for ussuri and from victoria onwards we only include the distro which we are testing completly. For example: If no testing for centos/opensuse distro then do not list them as tested distro."}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2020-05-11 17:25:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote-1

I'm in agreement with Wes. TripleO runs OpenStack on CentOS8, for both Ussuri and Train, and is running end to end with it using multiple testing scenarios for both upstream and downstream; results of these tests are all reported into gerrit. I think removing support for this distro sends the wrong message."}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2020-05-11 17:40:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Keep in mind that https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html#linux-distributions says "these are popular distributions [...] projects *should* (not must) perform functional tests on them" but not to what extent that happens or what form it takes (it doesn't even say that testing has to happen upstream). A number of our deployment projects test openstack services on CentOS, so it seems like that requirement could be considered met.

The subsequent section about tested runtimes also mentioned the list of popular distributions, but says that we use what versions of software is available on them to determine what to test, not that we necessarily conduct tests directly on them.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-05-11 17:56:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

With TripleO running on CentOS, I remove my vote.'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2020-05-11 18:48:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

https://review.opendev.org/#/c/726647/

DevStack includes support for CentOS 8 inside stable/ussuri.

Does that make things better?'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2020-05-11 19:18:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> https://review.opendev.org/#/c/726647/
 > 
 > DevStack includes support for CentOS 8 inside stable/ussuri.
 > 
 > Does that make things better?

+1'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2020-05-12 09:38:04.000000000', 'content': 'Removed Code-Review+1 by Jean-Philippe Evrard <jean-philippe@evrard.me>
'}, {'account_id': 13995, 'date': '2020-05-12 15:18:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote-1

Given the state of TripleO testing I think it is inadvisable to drop CentOS.'}, {'account_id': 16465, 'date': '2020-05-12 15:19:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote-1'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2020-05-12 15:20:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote-1

with devstack ad tripleo have running centos8 now we do not need to remove it but i really think we need to update/clear the defintion of distro in testing runtime. Those are not tested but used as base for some/all CI jobs'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2020-05-12 15:42:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> with devstack ad tripleo have running centos8 now we do not need to
 > remove it but i really think we need to update/clear the defintion
 > of distro in testing runtime. Those are not tested but used as base
 > for some/all CI jobs

Clarifying the distro testing things with what we do actually - https://review.opendev.org/#/c/727238/1'}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2020-05-12 15:49:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1

I think the idea of `tested` is we really tested against a certain percentage of core components. Which we're not. IMO, we can either rephrase this part or just remove both opensuse and centos here. I have no doubt that deployment tools can work on all of them (or only needs small fixes), but unless we actually enable tests against Ussuri, we should not keep it here. Never the last, we can still run tests against Ussuri even after we released it and said, `hey we find out it works for Ussuri now`."}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2020-05-12 16:01:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Rico Lin wrote:

> I think the idea of `tested` is we really tested against a certain
> percentage of core components.
[...]

But where does the current text even say that these are tested platforms? It says they're a list of platforms commonly used for deploying OpenStack, and that projects "should" run some functional tests (not that they "must"), but also doesn't say that they should run functional tests on *all* of these platforms either. There was extensive discussion in I8d63a883b29eda2757656008be3c6af83b8f9e88 which added this section, and to quote one of Doug's review comments:

The wording here is pragmatically flexible in terms of not expecting all tests to pass identically, or even to have the test jobs ("should" vs. "must").'}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2020-05-12 16:20:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Rico Lin wrote:
 > 
 > > I think the idea of `tested` is we really tested against a
 > certain
 > > percentage of core components.
 > [...]
 > 
 > But where does the current text even say that these are tested
 > platforms? It says they're a list of platforms commonly used for
 > deploying OpenStack, and that projects "should" run some functional
 > tests (not that they "must"), but also doesn't say that they should
 > run functional tests on *all* of these platforms either. There was
 > extensive discussion in I8d63a883b29eda2757656008be3c6af83b8f9e88
 > which added this section, and to quote one of Doug's review
 > comments:
 > 
 > The wording here is pragmatically flexible in terms of not
 > expecting all tests to pass identically, or even to have the test
 > jobs ("should" vs. "must").

As one of the options I mentioned, maybe we can just rephrase and  remove `Tested` from here will save a lot of confusion I have.
Or to adding some words here to clarify `Tested` here (I'm fine with some test better than nothing, and we don't need all tests to prove it, but some wording will help here)'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2020-05-12 16:25:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

 > should
 > > run functional tests on *all* of these platforms either. There
 > was
 > > extensive discussion in I8d63a883b29eda2757656008be3c6af83b8f9e88
 > > which added this section, and to quote one of Doug's review
 > > comments:
 > >
 > > The wording here is pragmatically flexible in terms of not
 > > expecting all tests to pass identically, or even to have the test
 > > jobs ("should" vs. "must").
 > 
 > As one of the options I mentioned, maybe we can just rephrase and 
 > remove `Tested` from here will save a lot of confusion I have.
 > Or to adding some words here to clarify `Tested` here (I'm fine
 > with some test better than nothing, and we don't need all tests to
 > prove it, but some wording will help here)

yeah, clarifying it in this with what we actually do or will do- https://review.opendev.org/#/c/727238/.'}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2020-05-12 16:40:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> > > Rico Lin wrote:
 > > >
 > > > > I think the idea of `tested` is we really tested against a
 > > > certain
 > > > > percentage of core components.
 > > > [...]
 > > >

 > > > platforms? It says they're a list of platforms commonly used
 > for
 > > > deploying OpenStack, and that projects "should" run some
 > > functional
 > > > tests (not that they "must"), but also doesn't say that they
 > > should
 > > > run functional tests on *all* of these platforms either. There
 > > was
 > > > extensive discussion in I8d63a883b29eda2757656008be3c6af83b8f9e88
 > > > which added this section, and to quote one of Doug's review
 > > > comments:
 > > >
 > > > The wording here is pragmatically flexible in terms of not

 > > > jobs ("should" vs. "must").
 > >
 > > As one of the options I mentioned, maybe we can just rephrase and
 > > remove `Tested` from here will save a lot of confusion I have.
 > > Or to adding some words here to clarify `Tested` here (I'm fine
 > > with some test better than nothing, and we don't need all tests
 > to
 > > prove it, but some wording will help here)
 > 
 > yeah, clarifying it in this with what we actually do or will do-
 > https://review.opendev.org/#/c/727238/.

Yes, I saw that one, let's keep the `tested` conversation going on that patch'}, {'account_id': 8099, 'date': '2020-05-12 17:22:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I am abstaining.

We should have removed it beforehand - I am not 100% comfortable with calling tripleo testing enough for the entire release, and projects have not had the opportunity to use their own devstack testing until very recently (like 33 hours ago).

I don't want to alienate the RDO community either, so let's ensure we flag these early.

Thanks Carlos for kicking off the conversation."}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2020-05-25 16:29:33.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

closing because majority is RC-1'}]

commit_message:
Remove CentOS 8 from tested runtimes for Ussuri

Support for CentOS 8 in Devstack is still in-progress and will not
available for Ussuri now that we are past feature freeze (April 6-10,
2020). As so, it is fair to say CentOS 8 is not a tested runtime by core
OpenStack services. CentOS 8 should be removed from the tested runtime
list for Ussuri.

Change-Id: Iea3bf704ea337cba06334df94cc18fc8950fa527

Is more than that warranted?'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2020-04-29 07:06:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I like the idea to loosen one of the steps to iterate faster.

I have the impression we have so much red tape for things that should be easy to implement, across all projects, that it makes us a tad inefficient.

I cannot say which one should go faster, the promotion or the propositions.

I would tend to say that if propositions go faster, TC can take the time to approve those, double check everything, and ask for more propositions. The other way around might reduce the speed.

I think this has pros and cons, and needs further discussing all of us together, no?'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2020-04-29 20:52:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

 > us together, no?

Goal schedule we preapred in last cycle is actually going to solve the goal delay issue. A per new goal schedule which we are going to start in V cycle for W cycle goals, we will have around 10-12 weeks to identify the goal and define the goal which is more than enough.

I was ready to do all the work and drive it across all the projects to deliver a net positive thing, but instead it was nitpicked to the last bit, with 14 alternative complicated architectures proposed and no one _actually_ proposing to get their hands dirty and do the work.

this is causing the systematic frustration of humans trying to contribute to openstack.  we need to stop letting people who want to drive stuff to move forward by having an alternative solution (that we don't have the resources to implement)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-28 19:48:17.000000000', 'message': 'Loosen voting for community goal proposals

Community goal proposals are intended to be an iterative process
according to the goal process documentation [1].  Goals should be
committed to the goals/proposed/ directory and then the committed goals
should later, as a separate action, be evaluated and the ones selected
as cycle goals should be moved to goals/selected/.

This change clarifies the wording in the goals process and house rules
to indicate that normal voting criteria should hold for proposed goals,
and full formal-vote criteria should hold for the selection of goals.
Presently formal-vote is used for all.

By loosening the criteria for voting it is hoped that the goals section
will be more like the ideas repository, a less constrained forum for
ideas to be proposed, debated, and refined.  Goals would still need at
least two TC members to merge as proposed, so there would still be
validation of the goals.  I believe this is the model that the goals
process refinement was hoping for.

Without this change, the formal-vote criteria for proposed goals voids
the iterative nature of goal development specified in the goal process
document.  Functionally it means that TC members hold off on voting
until goal selection.  This means that goals are not merged to the
goals/proposed/ directory, and there is no reason for it directory to
exist.  I believe this is a suboptimal result.

for more background, see the discussion on #openstack-tc on 28 April
2020 [2].

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/index.html#process-details
[2] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-tc/%23openstack-tc.2020-04-28.log.html#t2020-04-28T16:44:49

Change-Id: Ifa077520468e2caf218e5265f1ce4432ac3848ee

commit_message:
Loosen voting for community goal proposals

Community goal proposals are intended to be an iterative process
according to the goal process documentation [1].  Goals should be
committed to the goals/proposed/ directory and then the committed goals
should later, as a separate action, be evaluated and the ones selected
as cycle goals should be moved to goals/selected/.

This change clarifies the wording in the goals process and house rules
to indicate that normal voting criteria should hold for proposed goals,
and full formal-vote criteria should hold for the selection of goals.
Presently formal-vote is used for all.

By loosening the criteria for voting it is hoped that the goals section
will be more like the ideas repository, a less constrained forum for
ideas to be proposed, debated, and refined.  Goals would still need at
least two TC members to merge as proposed, so there would still be
validation of the goals.  I believe this is the model that the goals
process refinement was hoping for.

Without this change, the formal-vote criteria for proposed goals voids
the iterative nature of goal development specified in the goal process
document.  Functionally it means that TC members hold off on voting
until goal selection.  This means that goals are not merged to the
goals/proposed/ directory, and there is no reason for it directory to
exist.  I believe this is a suboptimal result.

for more background, see the discussion on #openstack-tc on 28 April
2020 [2].

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/index.html#process-details
[2] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-tc/%23openstack-tc.2020-04-28.log.html#t2020-04-28T16:44:49

Change-Id: Ifa077520468e2caf218e5265f1ce4432ac3848ee

commit_message:
Add Skip RHEL enforcement to Undercloud Upgrade Tasks

Adding skip_rhel_enforcement related task broke downstream CI testing as
undercloud upgrade/update tries to verify RHEL and fails. The flag was
intended for updates, but as Undercloud upgrade and update share the same
code [0] we also need the flag set to false.
This patch adds RHEL verification to FFWD as well as normal upgrade
tasks to fix undercloud upgrade as well as "overcloud upgrade prepare"

[0] - I076bebf6bbd5f45d5ecb372a3b83e8cc279946b8

Change-Id: Ica692fd82dba73e2b1f62b0ee02cc925f4df786f

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-07 15:19:36.000000000', 'message': 'Add missing SYSLOG_FACILITY to JournalHandler

Without SYSLOG_FACILITY log messages from journald forwards the message
to kern.log. This seems to be default behaviour as it treats the message
as kernel message.

This option provides a proper facility to the log message and kern.log
will not be filled up anymore.

Change-Id: I62a32ed46a400b62ead8c1e6e64acee658e2a769
Closes-Bug: #1871840
'}]
commit_message:
Add missing SYSLOG_FACILITY to JournalHandler

Without SYSLOG_FACILITY log messages from journald forwards the message
to kern.log. This seems to be default behaviour as it treats the message
as kernel message.

This option provides a proper facility to the log message and kern.log
will not be filled up anymore.

Change-Id: I62a32ed46a400b62ead8c1e6e64acee658e2a769
Closes-Bug: #1871840

commit_message:
Remove the unused coding style modules

Python modules related to coding style checks (listed in blacklist.txt in
openstack/requirements repo) are dropped from lower-constraints.txt
as they are not actually used in tests (other than pep8).

more info: https://github.com/openstack/requirements/blob/master/blacklist.txt

Change-Id: I65f45f9e8788d3a7df4078c3f1cc6eaf0069c140

messages: [{'account_id': 970, 'date': '2020-05-06 18:00:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2020-05-06 19:24:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2020-05-06 19:24:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2020-05-25 13:27:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1'}]

[{'created': '2020-05-06 18:00:03.000000000', 'message': 'Save the results from the early authentication

Somehow we lost the benefit of doing early authentication forcing
some of the project clients (particularly Identity) to do it again.
Saving the auth_ref in ClientManager is not enough, we need to stuff
it back into the Session too so it is also available to the non-SDK
clients.

Arguably this could be fixed in ClientManager.auth_ref itself but I
am not certain that is a desirable side-effect.  This solution
addresses the immediate concern.

clients.

Arguably this could be fixed in ClientManager.auth_ref itself but I
am not certain that is a desirable side-effect.  This solution
addresses the immediate concern.

Change-Id: Ie7aca398bba6fba30ef1b432daaefcd7d8b780e0

commit_message:
Save the results from the early authentication

Somehow we lost the benefit of doing early authentication forcing
some of the project clients (particularly Identity) to do it again.
Saving the auth_ref in ClientManager is not enough, we need to stuff
it back into the Session too so it is also available to the non-SDK
clients.

Arguably this could be fixed in ClientManager.auth_ref itself but I
am not certain that is a desirable side-effect.  This solution
addresses the immediate concern.

Change-Id: Ie7aca398bba6fba30ef1b432daaefcd7d8b780e0
Signed-off-by: Dean Troyer <dtroyer@gmail.com>

messages: [{'account_id': 17130, 'date': '2020-05-22 05:18:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 17130, 'date': '2020-05-22 06:51:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-05-22 06:58:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1\n\nzaqar has no PDF file'}, {'account_id': 17130, 'date': '2020-05-25 14:35:46.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-22 05:18:01.000000000', 'message': "Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file. Note that
the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org
where the PDF file is placed in the top-level html directory. The
site-preview places the PDF in a pdf directory.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: Ia54b3e25a7d80589b0974a287685cc1d674b4b96
"}, {'created': '2020-05-22 06:51:41.000000000', 'message': "Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Change-Id: Ia54b3e25a7d80589b0974a287685cc1d674b4b96

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file. Note that
the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org
where the PDF file is placed in the top-level html directory. The
site-preview places the PDF in a pdf directory.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: Ia54b3e25a7d80589b0974a287685cc1d674b4b96

Fix doc build failure

libvirt-python needs to be compiled also during doc building, add
"compile" target to bindep which is used for install and doc jobs.

This fixes the doc CI jobs.

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-27 21:38:20.000000000', 'message': '[wip] Introduce NeutronService helper

This helper is a way to unify the way of usage Neutron API and remove code
duplication.

 - NeutronWrapper was developed with a compatible to NovaNetworkWrapper
   interface. This means a lot of limitations that was introduced from
   the beggining
 - NeutronUtils was build on top of Scenario plugin class that makes it
   hard to be reusable from context objects

Change-Id: Ie87d5145c3b58f961fc56fe6375860919416318d

commit_message:
Introduce NeutronService helper

This helper is a way to unify the way of usage Neutron API and remove code
duplication.

 - NeutronWrapper was developed with a compatible to NovaNetworkWrapper
   interface. This means a lot of limitations that was introduced from
   the beggining
 - NeutronUtils was build on top of Scenario plugin class that makes it
   hard to be reusable from context objects

Change-Id: Ie87d5145c3b58f961fc56fe6375860919416318d

commit_message:
Use unittest.mock instead of third party mock

Now that we no longer support py27, we can use the standard library
unittest.mock module instead of the third party mock lib.

Change-Id: Ib3028d55552ef51d93aaf38653bca888166e6d27
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

subject: Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions
messages: [{'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-05-23 15:40:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 12021, 'date': '2020-05-25 07:28:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 8313, 'date': '2020-05-25 12:58:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-23 15:40:21.000000000', 'message': "Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file. Note that
the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org
where the PDF file is placed in the top-level html directory. The
site-preview places the PDF in a pdf directory.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I8cef6410228b4824afe974a5ab4279ef1bd35883
"}]
commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file. Note that
the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org
where the PDF file is placed in the top-level html directory. The
site-preview places the PDF in a pdf directory.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I8cef6410228b4824afe974a5ab4279ef1bd35883

[{'created': '2020-04-27 13:37:33.000000000', 'message': 'Fix tenant_id for a new port.

To successfully create a port in a shared network which belongs
to a different tenant, the tenant of the new port should be same
as the tenant of a request user.

Closes-bug: #1815461
Change-Id: Ia243f213b23f3f34845de5d97e8eaa5aa6979e76
(cherry picked from commit 3c33f46dc8196809d67301f20c8b920cad03b372)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix tenant_id for a new port.

To successfully create a port in a shared network which belongs
to a different tenant, the tenant of the new port should be same
as the tenant of a request user.

Closes-bug: #1815461
Change-Id: Ia243f213b23f3f34845de5d97e8eaa5aa6979e76
(cherry picked from commit 3c33f46dc8196809d67301f20c8b920cad03b372)

[{'created': '2018-11-05 19:30:24.000000000', 'message': 'quota: rename arguments to clarify they are limits

The DbQuotaDriver's get_project_quotas() and get_user_quotas() methods
have two kwargs called project_quotas and user_quotas. However, what was
actually passed in these arguments was *limits*, not "quotas". "Quotas"
are actually a dict of information more than just limits, and
get_project_quotas() and get_user_quotas() returns those "Quotas" dicts
which include keys like 'in_use' and 'remains'.

This patch renames the project_quotas and user_quotas arguments to
get_project_quotas() and get_user_quotas() to "project_limits" and
"user_limits" to make it clear what is contained in those things.

Change-Id: I53c2140e55d98c3326ca2ba60c905576ece131b8

commit_message:
quota: rename arguments to clarify they are limits

The DbQuotaDriver's get_project_quotas() and get_user_quotas() methods
have two kwargs called project_quotas and user_quotas. However, what was
actually passed in these arguments was *limits*, not "quotas". "Quotas"
are actually a dict of information more than just limits, and
get_project_quotas() and get_user_quotas() returns those "Quotas" dicts
which include keys like 'in_use' and 'remains'.

This patch renames the project_quotas and user_quotas arguments to
get_project_quotas() and get_user_quotas() to "project_limits" and
"user_limits" to make it clear what is contained in those things.

Change-Id: I53c2140e55d98c3326ca2ba60c905576ece131b8

subject: Mark sphinx extensions thread safe
messages: [{'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-04-13 13:59:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-04-14 11:03:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2\n\nWe're not generating docs that might clash with others so this seems safe"}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-05-25 12:32:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-13 13:59:17.000000000', 'message': 'Mark sphinx extensions thread safe

This adds the return of some metadata to our sphinx extension setup to
indicate they are thread safe. This is needed to allow consuming
projects to do multithreaded docs builds. In some cases, this can save a
noticeable amount of time in job execution.

Change-Id: I104271bc706fc33247548a147db0af05aa88737d
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Mark sphinx extensions thread safe

This adds the return of some metadata to our sphinx extension setup to
indicate they are thread safe. This is needed to allow consuming
projects to do multithreaded docs builds. In some cases, this can save a
noticeable amount of time in job execution.

Change-Id: I104271bc706fc33247548a147db0af05aa88737d
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Fix published docs

Change I90d064e63baa5f067f38a881eb9a556dfb435e97 contained a few typos
which broke the PDF and "Report a bug" icons on
https://docs.openstack.org/horizon/latest/ .

Fix the typos.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

Change-Id: Iab18f322331f13f85f64fb4730d276b9d351b8cc

commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I36fb84fdb2894f5286490499f02cc19dcf5392dc

messages: [{'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-05-23 15:45:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8313, 'date': '2020-05-25 12:58:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2\n\nthanks for working on this'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2020-05-25 13:12:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-23 15:45:40.000000000', 'message': "Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file. Note that
the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org
where the PDF file is placed in the top-level html directory. The
site-preview places the PDF in a pdf directory.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

Remove docs requirements from lower-constraints, they are not needed
during install or test but only for docs building.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I7ca3e89de3ca5cea2e5ad5004006650dbcc8448d
"}]
commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file. Note that
the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org
where the PDF file is placed in the top-level html directory. The
site-preview places the PDF in a pdf directory.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

Remove docs requirements from lower-constraints, they are not needed
during install or test but only for docs building.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I7ca3e89de3ca5cea2e5ad5004006650dbcc8448d

Oh, good to know that, thanks Sean! I've removed locally the hacking<2.1.0 cap from test-requirements.txt and then pep8 works like a charm."}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2020-05-12 15:09:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-05-12 15:10:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> > New release of hacking that properly locks down flake8 is on its

 > Oh, good to know that, thanks Sean! I've removed locally the
 > hacking<2.1.0 cap from test-requirements.txt and then pep8 works
 > like a charm.

That's the one trick. hacking is an independent, branchless deliverable. So I think we may need to backport a fix to raise the hacking cap to the latest 3.x release, then base this patch on top of it. Or let it merge, then recheck this.

The other option may be creating a 2.x branch for hacking, then doing a "stable" release in the 2.x series. May need those more involved in hacking to comment on what is the best route.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-05-12 15:11:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Remove redundant class docstring info

This now fails with the newest Sphinx due to multiple entries between
the added reference to the class's docstrings, and the docstrings
themselves. This fixes the warnings by just removing the duplication.

Also includes a squash of b1836ad4d2f091fa1825af91c09b3064012997dd
to cap flake8 to be < 3.8.0. The pep8 job will fail without this one,
but that can't merge because the docs job fails without this docstring
change.

Change-Id: I284a49a5df9506f936ebf1846688339c94d9a6b8
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 1b248b4f98a5f0b1c4a3aac45525d16986c47866)

commit_message:
Import modules, not classes

This addresses comments from I24b13c8654a33d99bf687a44a36cfdace39e3866
to follow guidelines to only import modules, not classes.

Change-Id: I0e66c08bfcdff306bac0121602d45b56cfb2c712
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
When edit role, check if the role already exists

When updating a role, changing the role name to an
existing one will cause the page to report an error.
This patch will first determine if the role name exists
when updating the role.

Change-Id: Ief075a542741e47bb00b3f9c338b292c38f09c5d
Closes-Bug: #1816685

commit_message:
Raise hacking minimum to 3.0.1

This raises hacking to a newer version, fixes a few issues the newer
version uncovered, and removes the cap for flake8 to allow that version
to be controlled by the hacking constraints.

Change-Id: Ie550119322bca3c217e4a74eca789f156cfa7e2c
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Add py38 package metadata

Now that we are running the Victoria tests that include a
voting py38, we can now add the Python 3.8 metadata to the
package information to reflect that support.

Change-Id: I8ceecac4f5ad6fb48b41d5106e2f6b67bf354763

[{'created': '2020-05-24 19:37:04.000000000', 'message': "Add the 'containers' field back to capsule

The capsule object is used to have the 'containers' field which
is the list of container objects. This field was accidentally

commit_message:
Add the 'containers' field back to capsule

The capsule object is used to have the 'containers' field which
is the list of container objects. This field was accidentally
removed during the merging of data model into container.
This commit adds this field back.

Change-Id: I2cdf365ae4c394eeef6672eed59855f36e7006fc
(cherry picked from commit 47f9fb16cbd0f9c761a87f5fe0f5d30a56b54452)

commit_message:
Add py38 package metadata

Now that we are running the Victoria tests that include a
voting py38, we can now add the Python 3.8 metadata to the
package information to reflect that support.

Change-Id: I0aa7f17f72438dd8eefb8f223ff7222064e4e99c

messages: [{'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2020-05-24 16:28:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2020-05-25 09:00:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-24 16:28:34.000000000', 'message': "Treat endpoints with trailing slashes the same way as without them

We've been historically using endpoints without trailing slashes in
our API. Apparently, some libraries (like gophercloud) are quite
opinionated about it (see the story), so let's handle both.

The implementation could be simpler if we just added trailing slash
to all routes, but it would cause redirects for current users.

Change-Id: Icbd971a8e792f93f9c3fa66ba29bec055dcdee32
Story: #2007660
Task: #39749
(cherry picked from commit 5ccef9cd06978f303b77de0feba19e4e85d5ec27)
"}]
commit_message:
Treat endpoints with trailing slashes the same way as without them

We've been historically using endpoints without trailing slashes in
our API. Apparently, some libraries (like gophercloud) are quite
opinionated about it (see the story), so let's handle both.

The implementation could be simpler if we just added trailing slash
to all routes, but it would cause redirects for current users.

Change-Id: Icbd971a8e792f93f9c3fa66ba29bec055dcdee32
Story: #2007660
Task: #39749
(cherry picked from commit 5ccef9cd06978f303b77de0feba19e4e85d5ec27)

commit_message:
Make the keystone job voting and re-enable commented out jobs

The keystone job used to be voting before the Python 3 transition.

Also uncomment the jobs that we're supposed to either fix or remove.

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-18 18:47:03.000000000', 'message': 'Fix hacking min version to 3.0.1

flake8 new release 3.8.0 added new checks and gate pep8
job start failing. hacking 3.0.1 fix the pinning of flake8 to
avoid bringing in a new version with new checks.

Though it is fixed in latest hacking but 2.0 and 3.0 has cap for
flake8 as <4.0.0 which mean flake8 new version 3.9.0 can also
break the pep8 job if new check are added.

To avoid similar gate break in future, we need to bump the hacking min
version.

- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014828.html

Change-Id: I54d3d778266d840bd724836018340d9bd3987844
(cherry picked from commit 52577c497deae4fad4667ad06d24aab12ee2627d)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix hacking min version to 3.0.1

flake8 new release 3.8.0 added new checks and gate pep8
job start failing. hacking 3.0.1 fix the pinning of flake8 to
avoid bringing in a new version with new checks.

Though it is fixed in latest hacking but 2.0 and 3.0 has cap for
flake8 as <4.0.0 which mean flake8 new version 3.9.0 can also
break the pep8 job if new check are added.

To avoid similar gate break in future, we need to bump the hacking min
version.

- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014828.html

Change-Id: I54d3d778266d840bd724836018340d9bd3987844
(cherry picked from commit 52577c497deae4fad4667ad06d24aab12ee2627d)

Congratulations, you've proposed your first change in OpenDev.

Your submission will now be tested automatically by Zuul, our gatekeeper,
and reviewed by other friendly developers. They will give you feedback and
may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches often take days (and sometimes weeks) to get reviewed, so be
patient. Don't hesitate to ask for help, and answer questions about your
work promptly if you can. The more you get to know reviewers and get to be
known by them, the smoother the review and approval process will become. The
fastest way to accomplish this is by reviewing other proposed changes
yourself: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for participating in OpenDev, we look forward to seeing you
around.

Workflow Guide: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html"}, {'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2020-05-25 12:00:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
add "verify_ssl_path" config for barbican key manager

Now we cann't use the verify_ssl if we set True, so we
add the "verify_ssl_path" config to solve it.

Closes-Bug: #1876102
Change-Id: I83bafe5b7e0c4cca67f773858007fb59d98a93a5

subject: Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions
messages: [{'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-05-21 18:26:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 12021, 'date': '2020-05-25 07:38:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 8313, 'date': '2020-05-25 11:24:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1\n\nLet's move the wheels :-)"}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-21 18:26:14.000000000', 'message': "Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file. Note that
the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org
where the PDF file is placed in the top-level html directory. The
site-preview places the PDF in a pdf directory.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: Iceea566b1ac539ba8204b9eb3b2f27754c0f0fe7
"}]
commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file. Note that
the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org
where the PDF file is placed in the top-level html directory. The
site-preview places the PDF in a pdf directory.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

commit_message:
Update master for stable/ussuri

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/ussuri.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/ussuri.

Sem-Ver: feature

commit_message:
Not load tempest_test_blacklist when tempest_run_skipped is true

We want to run only the tests in skiplist, so skiplist become the
whitelist. If we load both whitelist and skiplist, it will anulate each
other and no tests will be executed.

Change-Id: I99df5e074fea58824c2550abf7b48726cc3564a2

commit_message:
quota: clean up DbQuotaDriver unit tests

Converts the unit tests for the DbQuotaDriver to inherit from
nova.test.NoDBTestCase and mocks out all DB accesses that the unit tests
were still hitting.

A further cleanup would be to reduce the number of resources that are
passed to various unit tests, thereby reducing the expected results
checks that need to be done. However, we can work on that in a later
patch. This patch sticks to just enforcing the same assertions that were
in the original unit tests.

Change-Id: I6607ca780e036a835eb14830ffd8382192071ea0

subject: Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions
messages: [{'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-05-21 18:20:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-05-22 21:03:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-05-25 11:40:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-21 18:20:18.000000000', 'message': "Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file. Note that
the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org
where the PDF file is placed in the top-level html directory. The
site-preview places the PDF in a pdf directory.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: If5b3ea5c50a91f623b0dd4d1dd347ee8a6b90290
"}]
commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file. Note that
the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org
where the PDF file is placed in the top-level html directory. The
site-preview places the PDF in a pdf directory.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: If5b3ea5c50a91f623b0dd4d1dd347ee8a6b90290

commit_message:
Remove incubation section from template.rst

oslo-incubator is no longer a thing and any new library proposals
should be using the new library template anyway.

Change-Id: Ic05552e762c9e72e7cc7fc388c1a67d76c63fc5b

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-24 13:16:21.000000000', 'message': "Switch to newer openstackdocstheme version

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 version. Using
this version will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file. Note that
the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org
where the PDF file is placed in the top-level html directory. The
site-preview places the PDF in a pdf directory.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I263e2109e455ee98a940cb34356e37473413cad4
"}]
commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme version

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 version. Using
this version will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file. Note that
the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org
where the PDF file is placed in the top-level html directory. The
site-preview places the PDF in a pdf directory.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I263e2109e455ee98a940cb34356e37473413cad4

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file. Note that
the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org
where the PDF file is placed in the top-level html directory. The
site-preview places the PDF in a pdf directory.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.
This repo uses storyboard, configure the proper variables.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: Id084bfc9d5ae7a95d3cba22a00b4c03a35967ee4

commit_message:
[Storwize] fix retype vdisk io group process

The original retype vdisk IO group process does not follow the best
practice of Storize. This patch change the command order of retype IO
group and add sleep time between important operations.

Closes-Bug: 1879846
Change-Id: I7af919028fd0daf8a2f2dc4f74fdb98e45ebf0aa

Other functions are left because it's difficult
to determine if they should be mechanically deleted.

commit_message:
trivial: Remove unused inner functions of UT and FT

Picked up unused fuctions with vulture [1].
In this patch, from the picked up functions,
the inner-functions prefixed with '_' are deleted as dead code.
Only target the inner-function of unittest and functional-test.
Other functions are left because it's difficult
to determine if they should be mechanically deleted.

[1] https://pypi.org/project/vulture/

Change-Id: I0deb0bdc9e7a7dd1cf7f98f22686ca7727088e22
Closes-Bug: #1879871

commit_message:
Switch to hacking 3.0

This patch update hacking version to 3.0.0[1]. In order to make code
compatible with new hacking rules E305, E117 pep8 errors are fixed
in code. It also drop flake8, hacking, django-babel, mox3, six
packages from lower-requirements.txt

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014828.html

Change-Id: I86bc2faed43e7df38682e23866ad4a4303e82667

commit_message:
Some cleanups

Some small changes for Victoria:
* Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg
* Add Python 3.8 to setup.cfg
* Update hacking to version 3.1.0, disable E741 as we can ignore
  this.
* Switch to victoria jobs
* Remove oslosphinx specific conditions from conf.py, oslosphinx is
  retired and will not work with current Sphinx/python/reno anyhow.

Change-Id: I3a16eb66af59c8bd27b36c203260cfd3197f52f0

commit_message:
Improve readability of vnflcm show command

Display show command data in human_readable format for better
readability for complex attributes of vnf instance like
'vimConnectionInfo', 'instantiatedVnfInfo', '_links'.

Please checkout below link to see the difference in vnflcm show
response data before and after resolving the issue.
http://paste.openstack.org/show/792866

Change-Id: I52684618f7042f5566ea3bed7255d17d2fd61df2

subject: Switch to newer openstackdocstheme version
messages: [{'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-05-25 07:03:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-05-25 08:49:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2020-05-25 09:52:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-25 07:03:32.000000000', 'message': "Switch to newer openstackdocstheme version

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 version. Using
this version will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I778b288f3b478c0fe1718bf5517c2c818b8d305e
"}]
commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme version

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 version. Using
this version will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I778b288f3b478c0fe1718bf5517c2c818b8d305e

commit_message:

The removed parts are *not* to be done 99% of operators' time,
especially for quickstart procedure.
Kolla Ansible is meant to default to a compatible release.

See [1] as well.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/730498

commit_message:
Use unittest.mock instead of third party mock

Now that we no longer support py27, we can use the standard library
unittest.mock module instead of the third party mock lib.

Change-Id: I67fcc16530f1c46eecb62e27eb7b88d1dee6f9df
Signed-off-by: Takashi Natsume <takanattie@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-23 16:52:31.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes user and project search by name in openstack_user resource

As project and user names are only unique for each domain and some
Keystone settings may filter user listing, any user or project search by
name needs to include the associated domain.

This change fixes any search done by name of a project or user in the
openstack_user resource. It is
assumed that if no domain is specified and there are multiple elements
with the same name, the first search result is
chosen.

Closes-Bug: #1871144

Change-Id: I0ed3ffabab5f8b0959c3b2c50a3619f378e59c9e
Signed-off-by: Henrique Santos <hfigueiredosantos@tecnico.ulisboa.pt>
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes user and project search by name in openstack_user resource

As project and user names are only unique for each domain and some
Keystone settings may filter user listing, any user or project search by
name needs to include the associated domain.

This change fixes any search done by name of a project or user in the
openstack_user resource. It is
assumed that if no domain is specified and there are multiple elements
with the same name, the first search result is
chosen.

Closes-Bug: #1871144

Change-Id: I0ed3ffabab5f8b0959c3b2c50a3619f378e59c9e
Signed-off-by: Henrique Santos <hfigueiredosantos@tecnico.ulisboa.pt>

Used to be: git.openstack.org/openstack/monasca-persister?h=stable/pike
Now : releases.openstack.org/constraints/upper/pike

Since the way links to specific branches changed, usage of
those links has to be changed as well.
CONSTRAINTS_BRANCH variable was removed because CONSTRAINTS_FILE
contains link to the upper-requirements file with specified branch.

Change-Id: Ic67b2b30906768fa6249d10ed2c7e8037df0f544
Story: 2005666
Task: 30971
'}]
commit_message:
Change repository links usage in Dockerfile and build image

Used to be: git.openstack.org/openstack/monasca-persister?h=stable/pike
Now : releases.openstack.org/constraints/upper/pike

Since the way links to specific branches changed, usage of
those links has to be changed as well.
CONSTRAINTS_BRANCH variable was removed because CONSTRAINTS_FILE
contains link to the upper-requirements file with specified branch.

Change-Id: Ic67b2b30906768fa6249d10ed2c7e8037df0f544
Story: 2005666
Task: 30971

random python - getting script directory is perfectly
doable in bash.

to e.g. prevent custom config from interfering with it.
We might be willing to steer Ansible from Python in the future
anyhow.

commit_message:
Check that used Ansible can see Kolla Ansible

Fix-feature following up on the original check [1] to make it
test the correct interpreter.

Additionally, this change removes last, unneeded call to
random python - getting script directory is perfectly
doable in bash.

All checks are done from Python, not Ansible, due to its
performance. Python version feels snappy (0.2 s to check),
compared to sluggish Ansible (2.0 s to check).
What is more, relying on Ansible would require hacky solutions
to e.g. prevent custom config from interfering with it.
We might be willing to steer Ansible from Python in the future
anyhow.

[1] Icf0399d21b3fde8d530d73e6e7ee4a57665da276

Change-Id: Ib8f2e6b6672e7c06aa94bc226c4d72640d25d8c2
Closes-Bug: #1856346

commit_message:
Use unittest.mock instead of third party mock

Now that we no longer support py27, we can use the standard library
unittest.mock module instead of the third party mock lib.

Change-Id: I2cf3afe0ce833e5d85563a6b10f9ac71f3b8c485
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

subject: Switch to newer openstackdocstheme version
messages: [{'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-05-24 13:15:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 24828, 'date': '2020-05-24 14:55:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2020-05-25 08:35:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-05-24 13:15:10.000000000', 'message': "Switch to newer openstackdocstheme version

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 version. Using
this version will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file. Note that
the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org
where the PDF file is placed in the top-level html directory. The
site-preview places the PDF in a pdf directory.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: Ifc57df7591d861508e761b8accc56efd32d762bc
"}]
commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme version

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 version. Using
this version will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file. Note that
the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org
where the PDF file is placed in the top-level html directory. The
site-preview places the PDF in a pdf directory.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: Ifc57df7591d861508e761b8accc56efd32d762bc

subject: Replace Chinese punctuation with English punctuation
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-23 02:49:49.000000000', 'message': 'Replace Chinese punctuation with English punctuation

Curly quotes(Chinese punctuation) usually input from Chinese input method.

Change-Id: Ibefcccf544a52294ae9119b40488131134521ad7
'}]
commit_message:
Replace Chinese punctuation with English punctuation

Curly quotes(Chinese punctuation) usually input from Chinese input method.
When read from english context, it makes some confusion.

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering

Update Sphinx version as well.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I612722e75975d6cfd5fc61037834b675117019e7

commit_message:
Configure ansible-role-lunasa-hsm for release

This patch adds the publish-to-pypi template to the ansible
role repo, as well as a storyboard project to track issues.

Change-Id: Id0d49459d84ad9540ef373a838a01ca0ca06486c

commit_message:
Allow ansible-collections-openstack-release team to push tags

ansible-collections-openstack doesn't do openstack releases and
needs to be able to push signed tags.

Change-Id: I8414d97f7b41040c2b9bae0a490093c2a6bcf097

commit_message:
Add an appendix on bridge iface config

In light of the deprecation of Linux bridge + veth setup, some guidance
on the data-port and bridge-interface-mappings configuration options
usage is needed. The added appendix provides some information which can
later be extended to cover cases like SR-IOV.

Change-Id: I251c40b291210ea48d29fc2139b0e80e130a548e
Related-Bug: #1877594

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 26114, 'date': '2020-03-20 07:03:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> (1 comment)

Hi Goutham,

The share size inflation might not be able to disable, it is the implementation of Unity, the smallest size is 3GB when we creating filesystem in Unity, my concern is disabling it may introduce unexpected issues.

There is an option "filter_function" in manila.conf, could we control the Unity filter function by setting 'filter_function = "share.size >= 3"' in Unity backend section? Or it is a global option to control all backends?

If it is a global option, I think I will submit a patch to implement the default filter function and add an option to enable/disable the filter function reporting.'}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2020-04-15 13:54:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> The share size inflation might not be able to disable, it is the implementation of Unity, the smallest size is 3GB when we creating filesystem in Unity, my concern is disabling it may introduce unexpected issues.
> There is an option "filter_function" in manila.conf, could we control the Unity filter function by setting 'filter_function = "share.size >= 3"' in Unity backend section? Or it is a global option to control all backends?

This is less preferable, since it enforces that we'd need this option to be set by an deployer/administrator in each deployment

> If it is a global option, I think I will submit a patch to implement the default filter function and add an option to enable/disable the filter function reporting.

It's a per-backend option, and the default_filter_function can be advertised by the driver... it'll allow the driver to piggyback a default on whatever is configured by the administrator. I agree you could add a Unity specific config option to disable this default filter reporting and set that option to True for a couple of releases and then flip the default so we don't surprise existing deployments. What do you think?'}, {'account_id': 26114, 'date': '2020-04-29 15:01:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2020-04-29 19:12:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)

This looks good, thank you.

commit_message:
[Unity] Implements default filter function

Implements the default filter function for Unity driver, if the
share size is smaller than 3GB, will not schedule the share
creation to Unity backend.

Change-Id: Iebb5063d4e1c4c2f5ddce0d5000b7d51dcb0605b
Closes-bug: #1652379

commit_message:
Fix networking bgpvpn tempest plugin to installed in tempest venv

networking bgpvpn tempest plugin is in-tree plugin till stein and
used to be run with all-plugins tox env which does not work now for
python2.7 jobs. Temepst venv is installed with py3 and all-plugins
no longer detect the system wide installed tempest plugins.

This commit makes to installed networking bgpvpn as tempest plugins so
that Tempest venv can detect it and run tests with 'all' tox env.

Partial-Bug: #1880217

Change-Id: I2a138b859798c63519257fa5986a3bdcf43ded2c

commit_message:
Fix tenant_id for a new port.

To successfully create a port in a shared network which belongs
to a different tenant, the tenant of the new port should be same
as the tenant of a request user.

Closes-bug: #1815461
Change-Id: Ia243f213b23f3f34845de5d97e8eaa5aa6979e76
(cherry picked from commit 3c33f46dc8196809d67301f20c8b920cad03b372)

* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.
